medical_history.chief_complaint: Palpitations and finding of ventricular extrasystoles on a Holter recording.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had an episode of 'convulsions' while watching television two months before referral, which included turning blue and developing seizures. After regaining consciousness, she experienced nausea and palpitations, prompting a positive pregnancy test which led to Holter recording.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Convulsive disorder with no previous episodes documented; no history of heart disease.
medical_history.family_history: The patient was the only child of healthy parents. Two maternal cousins had a history of syncope diagnosed as 'vasovagal' and 'hysterical', with no family history of sudden death.
